name: meta
description:
The metamodel for schemas defined using the Linked Data Modeling Language framework.

For more information on LinkML:

* [linkml.io](https://linkml.io) main website
* [specification](https://w3id.org/linkml/docs/specification/)

LinkML is self-describing. Every LinkML schema consists of elements
that instantiate classes in this metamodel.

Core metaclasses:

* [SchemaDefinition](https://w3id.org/linkml/SchemaDefinition)
* [ClassDefinition](https://w3id.org/linkml/ClassDefinition)
* [SlotDefinition](https://w3id.org/linkml/SlotDefinition)
* [TypeDefinition](https://w3id.org/linkml/TypeDefinition)

There are many subsets of *profiles* of the metamodel, for different purposes:

* [MinimalSubset](https://w3id.org/linkml/MinimalSubset)
* [BasicSubset](https://w3id.org/linkml/BasicSubset)

For canonical reference documentation on any metamodel construct,
refer to the official URI for each construct, e.g.
[https://w3id.org/linkml/is_a](https://w3id.org/linkml/is_a)
title: LinkML Schema Metamodel

subsets.name: MinimalSubset
subsets.description:
The absolute minimal set of elements necessary for defining any schema.

schemas conforming to the minimal subset consist of classes, with all slots
inlined as attributes. There are no enums.
subsets.title: minimal subset

subsets.name: BasicSubset
subsets.description:
An extension of MinimalSubset that avoids advanced constructs and can be implemented by a broad variety of tools.

This subset roughly corresponds to the union of most standard constructs used in relational datamodel modeling,
object oriented modeling, and simple JSON-style modeling, while avoiding more advanced constructs from these languages.

It is often possible to translate from a more expressive schema to a BasicSubset schema, through a schema derivation
process
subsets.title: basic subset

subsets.name: SpecificationSubset
subsets.description:
A subset that includes all the metamodel elements that form part of the normative LinkML specification.

The complete LinkML specification can be found at [linkml:specification](https://w3id.org/linkml/specification)
subsets.title: specification subset

subsets.name: RelationalModelProfile
subsets.description:
A profile that includes all the metamodel elements whose semantics can be expressed using the classic Relational Model.
The Relational Model excludes collections (multivalued slots) as first class entities. Instead, these must be
mapped to backreferences

The classic Relational Model excludes inheritance and polymorphism -- these must be rolled down to
concrete classes or otherwise transformed.
subsets.title: relational model profile

subsets.name: ObjectOrientedProfile
subsets.description:
A profile that includes all the metamodel elements whose semantics can be expressed using a minimal
implementation of the object oriented metamodel as employed by languages such as Java and Python, or
in modeling frameworks like UML
subsets.title: object oriented profile

subsets.name: OwlProfile
subsets.description: A profile that includes all the metamodel elements whose semantics can be expressed in OWL
subsets.title: owl profile

types.name: string
notes: In RDF serializations, a slot with range of string is treated as a literal or type xsd:string.   If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "string".

types.name: integer
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "integer".

types.name: boolean
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "boolean".

types.name: float
types.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "float".

types.name: double
types.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "double".

types.name: decimal
types.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "decimal".

types.name: time
types.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners do not work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "time".

types.name: date
types.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date".

types.name: datetime
types.description: The combination of a date and time
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "datetime".

types.name: date_or_datetime
types.description: Either a date or a datetime
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date_or_datetime".

types.name: uriorcurie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uriorcurie".

types.name: curie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "curie".
comments: in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

types.name: uri
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uri".
comments: in RDF serializations a slot with range of uri is treated as a literal or type xsd:anyURI unless it is an identifier or a reference to an identifier, in which case it is translated directly to a node

types.name: ncname
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "ncname".

types.name: objectidentifier
types.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "objectidentifier".
comments: Used for inheritance and type checking

types.name: nodeidentifier
types.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "nodeidentifier".

types.name: jsonpointer
types.description: A string encoding a JSON Pointer. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to a valid object within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpointer".

types.name: jsonpath
types.description: A string encoding a JSON Path. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpath".

types.name: sparqlpath
types.description: A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "sparqlpath".

enums.name: pv_formula_options
enums.description: The formula used to generate the set of permissible values from the code_set values

permissible_values.description: The permissible values are the set of possible codes in the code set
The permissible values are the set of CURIES in the code set
The permissible values are the set of code URIs in the code set
The permissible values are the set of FHIR coding elements derived from the code set
The permissible values are the set of human readable labels in the code set

enums.name: presence_enum
enums.description: enumeration of conditions by which a slot value should be set

enums.name: relational_role_enum
enums.description: enumeration of roles a slot on a relationship class can play

permissible_values.description: a slot with this role connects a relationship to its subject/source node
a slot with this role connects a relationship to its object/target node
a slot with this role connects a relationship to its predicate/property
a slot with this role connects a symmetric relationship to a node that represents either subject or object node
a slot with this role connects a relationship to a node that is not subject/object/predicate

enums.name: alias_predicate_enum
enums.description: permissible values for the relationship between an element and an alias

slots.name: name
slots.description: the unique name of the element within the context of the schema.  Name is combined with the default prefix to form the globally unique subject of the target class.

slots.name: title
slots.description: A concise human-readable display label for the element. The title should mirror the name, and should use ordinary textual punctuation.

slots.name: conforms_to
slots.description: An established standard to which the element conforms.

slots.name: implements
slots.description: An element in another schema which this element conforms to. The referenced element is not imported into the schema for the implementing element. However, the referenced schema may be used to check conformance of the implementing element.

slots.name: instantiates
slots.description: An element in another schema which this element instantiates.

slots.name: categories
slots.description: Controlled terms used to categorize an element.
comments: if you wish to use uncontrolled terms or terms that lack identifiers then use the keywords element

slots.name: keywords
slots.description: Keywords or tags used to describe the element

slots.name: definition_uri
slots.description: The native URI of the element. This is always within the namespace of the containing schema. Contrast with the assigned URI, via class_uri or slot_uri
comments: Formed by combining the default_prefix with the normalized element name
slots.readonly: filled in by the schema loader or schema view

slots.name: id_prefixes
slots.description: An allowed list of prefixes for which identifiers must conform. The identifier of this class or slot must begin with the URIs referenced by this prefix
comments: Order of elements may be used to indicate priority order
If identifiers are treated as CURIEs, then the CURIE must start with one of the indicated prefixes followed by `:` (_should_ start if the list is open)
If identifiers are treated as URIs, then the URI string must start with the expanded for of the prefix (_should_ start if the list is open)

slots.name: id_prefixes_are_closed
slots.description: If true, then the id_prefixes slot is treated as being closed, and any use of an id that does not have this prefix is considered a violation.

slots.name: description
slots.description: a textual description of the element's purpose and use

slots.name: structured_aliases
slots.description: A list of structured_alias objects, used to provide aliases in conjunction with additional metadata.

slots.name: aliases
slots.description: Alternate names/labels for the element. These do not alter the semantics of the schema, but may be useful to support search and alignment.
comments: not be confused with the metaslot alias.

slots.name: deprecated
slots.description: Description of why and when this element will no longer be used
comments: note that linkml does not use a boolean to indicate deprecation status - the presence of a string value in this field is sufficient to indicate deprecation.

slots.name: todos
slots.description: Outstanding issues that needs resolution

slots.name: notes
slots.description: editorial notes about an element intended primarily for internal consumption

slots.name: comments
slots.description: notes and comments about an element intended primarily for external consumption

slots.name: in_subset
slots.description: used to indicate membership of a term in a defined subset of terms used for a particular domain or application.
comments: an example of use in the translator_minimal subset in the biolink model, holding the minimal set of predicates used in a translator knowledge graph

slots.name: from_schema
slots.description: id of the schema that defined the element
notes: A stronger model would be range schema_definition, but this doesn't address the import model
slots.readonly: supplied by the schema loader or schema view

slots.name: imported_from
slots.description: the imports entry that this element was derived from.  Empty means primary source
slots.readonly: supplied by the schema loader or schema view

slots.name: see_also
slots.description: A list of related entities or URLs that may be of relevance

slots.name: owned_by
slots.description: agent that owns or is the steward of the element

slots.name: created_by
slots.description: agent that created the element

slots.name: contributors
slots.description: agent that contributed to the element

slots.name: created_on
slots.description: time at which the element was created

slots.name: last_updated_on
slots.description: time at which the element was last updated

slots.name: modified_by
slots.description: agent that modified the element

slots.name: status
slots.description: status of the element

slots.name: literal_form
slots.description: The literal lexical form of a structured alias; i.e the actual alias value.

slots.name: alias_predicate
slots.description: The relationship between an element and its alias.

slots.name: in_language
slots.description: the primary language used in the sources
comments: Recommended to use a string from IETF BCP 47

slots.name: source
slots.description: A related resource from which the element is derived.
comments: The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part

slots.name: publisher
slots.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available

slots.name: is_a
slots.description: A primary parent class or slot from which inheritable metaslots are propagated from. While multiple inheritance is not allowed, mixins can be provided effectively providing the same thing. The semantics are the same when translated to formalisms that allow MI (e.g. RDFS/OWL). When translating to a SI framework (e.g. java classes, python classes) then is a is used. When translating a framework without polymorphism (e.g. json-schema, solr document schema) then is a and mixins are recursively unfolded

slots.name: abstract
slots.description: Indicates the class or slot cannot be directly instantiated and is intended for grouping purposes.

slots.name: mixin
slots.description: Indicates the class or slot is intended to be inherited from without being an is_a parent. mixins should not be inherited from using is_a, except by other mixins.

slots.name: mixins
slots.description: A collection of secondary parent classes or slots from which inheritable metaslots are propagated from.
comments: mixins act in the same way as parents (is_a). They allow a model to have a primary strict hierarchy, while keeping the benefits of multiple inheritance

slots.name: apply_to
slots.description: Used to extend class or slot definitions. For example, if we have a core schema where a gene has two slots for identifier and symbol, and we have a specialized schema for my_organism where we wish to add a slot systematic_name, we can avoid subclassing by defining a class gene_my_organism, adding the slot to this class, and then adding an apply_to pointing to the gene class. The new slot will be 'injected into' the gene class.

slots.name: values_from
slots.description: The identifier of a "value set" -- a set of identifiers that form the possible values for the range of a slot. Note: this is different than 'subproperty_of' in that 'subproperty_of' is intended to be a single ontology term while 'values_from' is the identifier of an entire value set.  Additionally, this is different than an enumeration in that in an enumeration, the values of the enumeration are listed directly in the model itself. Setting this property on a slot does not guarantee an expansion of the ontological hierarchy into an enumerated list of possible values in every serialization of the model.

slots.name: code_set
slots.description: the identifier of an enumeration code set.

slots.name: code_set_version
slots.description: the version identifier of the enumeration code set
comments: we assume that version identifiers lexically sort in temporal order. Recommend semver when possible

slots.name: code_set_tag
slots.description: the version tag of the enumeration code set
comments: enum_expression cannot have both a code_set_tag and a code_set_version

slots.name: pv_formula
slots.description: Defines the specific formula to be used to generate the permissible values.
comments: you cannot have BOTH the permissible_values and permissible_value_formula tag
code_set must be supplied for this to be valid

slots.name: permissible_values
slots.description: A list of possible values for a slot range

slots.name: enum_uri
slots.description: URI of the enum that provides a semantic interpretation of the element in a linked data context. The URI may come from any namespace and may be shared between schemas

slots.name: include
slots.description: An enum expression that yields a list of permissible values that are to be included, after subtracting the minus set

slots.name: minus
slots.description: An enum expression that yields a list of permissible values that are to be subtracted from the enum

slots.name: inherits
slots.description: An enum definition that is used as the basis to create a new enum
comments: All permissible values for all inherited enums are copied to form the initial seed set

slots.name: matches
slots.description: Specifies a match query that is used to calculate the list of permissible values

slots.name: identifier_pattern
slots.description: A regular expression that is used to obtain a set of identifiers from a source_ontology to construct a set of permissible values

slots.name: concepts
slots.description: A list of identifiers that are used to construct a set of permissible values

slots.name: reachable_from
slots.description: Specifies a query for obtaining a list of permissible values based on graph reachability

slots.name: source_ontology
slots.description: An ontology or vocabulary or terminology that is used in a query to obtain a set of permissible values
comments: examples include schema.org, wikidata, or an OBO ontology
for obo ontologies we recommend CURIEs of the form obo:cl, obo:envo, etc

slots.name: is_direct
slots.description: True if the reachability query should only include directly related nodes, if False then include also transitively connected

slots.name: traverse_up
slots.description: True if the direction of the reachability query is reversed and ancestors are retrieved

slots.name: include_self
slots.description: True if the query is reflexive

slots.name: relationship_types
slots.description: A list of relationship types (properties) that are used in a reachability query

slots.name: source_nodes
slots.description: A list of nodes that are used in the reachability query

slots.name: text
slots.description: The actual permissible value itself
comments: there are no constraints on the text of the permissible value, but for many applications you may want to consider following idiomatic forms and using computer-friendly forms

slots.name: meaning
slots.description: the value meaning of a permissible value
notes: we may want to change the range of this (and other) elements in the model to an entitydescription type construct

slots.name: id
slots.description: The official schema URI

slots.name: emit_prefixes
slots.description: a list of Curie prefixes that are used in the representation of instances of the model.  All prefixes in this list are added to the prefix sections of the target models.

slots.name: version
slots.description: particular version of schema

slots.name: imports
slots.description: A list of schemas that are to be included in this schema

slots.name: structured_imports
slots.description: A list of specifications for how to import elements from external schemas

slots.name: license
slots.description: license for the schema

slots.name: default_curi_maps
slots.description: ordered list of prefixcommon biocontexts to be fetched to resolve id prefixes and inline prefix variables

slots.name: default_prefix
slots.description: The prefix that is used for all elements within a schema

slots.name: default_range
slots.description: default slot range to be used if range element is omitted from a slot definition

slots.name: subsets
slots.description: An index to the collection of all subset definitions in the schema

slots.name: types
slots.description: An index to the collection of all type definitions in the schema

slots.name: enums
slots.description: An index to the collection of all enum definitions in the schema

slots.name: slot_definitions
slots.description: An index to the collection of all slot definitions in the schema
comments: note the formal name of this element is slot_definitions, but it has alias slots, which is the canonical form used in yaml/json serializes of schemas.

slots.name: classes
slots.description: An index to the collection of all class definitions in the schema

slots.name: metamodel_version
slots.description: Version of the metamodel used to load the schema
slots.readonly: supplied by the schema loader or schema view

slots.name: source_file
slots.description: name, uri or description of the source of the schema

slots.name: source_file_date
slots.description: modification date of the source of the schema

slots.name: source_file_size
slots.description: size in bytes of the source of the schema
slots.readonly: supplied by the schema loader or schema view

slots.name: generation_date
slots.description: date and time that the schema was loaded/generated
slots.readonly: supplied by the schema loader or schema view

slots.name: slots
slots.description: collection of slot names that are applicable to a class
comments: the list of applicable slots is inherited from parent classes

This defines the set of slots that are allowed to be used for a given class. The final list of slots for a class is the combination of the parent (is a) slots, mixins slots, apply to slots minus the slot usage entries.

slots.name: slot_usage
slots.description: the refinement of a slot in the context of the containing class definition.
comments: Many slots may be re-used across different classes, but the meaning of the slot may be refined by context. For example, a generic association model may use slots subject/predicate/object with generic semantics and minimal constraints. When this is subclasses, e.g. to disease-phenotype associations then slot usage may specify both local naming (e.g. subject=disease) and local constraints

slots.name: enum_range
slots.description: An inlined enumeration

slots.name: range_expression
slots.description: A range that is described as a boolean expression combining existing ranges
comments: one use for this is being able to describe a range using any_of expressions, for example to combine two enums

slots.name: boolean_slot
slots.description: A grouping of slots that expression a boolean operator over a list of operands

slots.name: any_of
slots.description: holds if at least one of the expressions hold

slots.name: exactly_one_of
slots.description: holds if only one of the expressions hold

slots.name: none_of
slots.description: holds if none of the expressions hold

slots.name: all_of
slots.description: holds if all of the expressions hold

slots.name: preconditions
slots.description: an expression that must hold in order for the rule to be applicable to an instance

slots.name: postconditions
slots.description: an expression that must hold for an instance of the class, if the preconditions hold

slots.name: elseconditions
slots.description: an expression that must hold for an instance of the class, if the preconditions no not hold

slots.name: bidirectional
slots.description: in addition to preconditions entailing postconditions, the postconditions entail the preconditions

slots.name: open_world
slots.description: if true, the the postconditions may be omitted in instance data, but it is valid for an inference engine to add these

slots.name: rank
slots.description: the relative order in which the element occurs, lower values are given precedence
comments: the rank of an element does not affect the semantics

slots.name: deactivated
slots.description: a deactivated rule is not executed by the rules engine

slots.name: rules
slots.description: the collection of rules that apply to all members of this class

slots.name: classification_rules
slots.description: The collection of classification rules that apply to all members of this class. Classification rules allow for automatically assigning the instantiated type of an instance.

slots.name: slot_conditions
slots.description: expresses constraints on a group of slots for a class expression

slots.name: attributes
slots.description: Inline definition of slots
comments: attributes are an alternative way of defining new slots.  An attribute adds a slot to the global space in the form <class_name>__<slot_name> (lower case, double underscores).  Attributes can be specialized via slot_usage.

slots.name: class_uri
slots.description: URI of the class that provides a semantic interpretation of the element in a linked data context. The URI may come from any namespace and may be shared between schemas
comments: Assigning class_uris can provide additional hooks for interoperation, indicating a common conceptual model

slots.name: subclass_of
slots.description: DEPRECATED -- rdfs:subClassOf to be emitted in OWL generation

slots.name: defining_slots
slots.description: The combination of is a plus defining slots form a genus-differentia definition, or the set of necessary and sufficient conditions that can be transformed into an OWL equivalence axiom

slots.name: union_of
slots.description: indicates that the domain element consists exactly of the members of the element in the range.
notes: this only applies in the OWL generation

slots.name: tree_root
slots.description: Indicates that this is the Container class which forms the root of the serialized document structure in tree serializations
notes: each schema should have at most one tree root

slots.name: unique_keys
slots.description: A collection of named unique keys for this class. Unique keys may be singular or compound.

slots.name: unique_key_name
slots.description: name of the unique key

slots.name: consider_nulls_inequal
slots.description: By default, None values are considered equal for the purposes of comparisons in determining uniqueness. Set this to true to treat missing values as per ANSI-SQL NULLs, i.e NULL=NULL is always False.

slots.name: unique_key_slots
slots.description: list of slot names that form a key. The tuple formed from the values of all these slots should be unique.

slots.name: slot_names_unique
slots.description: if true then induced/mangled slot names are not created for class_usage and attributes

slots.name: domain
slots.description:
defines the type of the subject of the slot.  Given the following slot definition
  S1:
    domain: C1
    range:  C2
the declaration
  X:
    S1: Y

implicitly asserts that X is an instance of C1

slots.name: range
slots.description:
defines the type of the object of the slot.  Given the following slot definition
  S1:
    domain: C1
    range:  C2
the declaration
  X:
    S1: Y

implicitly asserts Y is an instance of C2
comments: range is underspecified, as not all elements can appear as the range of a slot.

slots.name: slot_uri
slots.description: URI of the class that provides a semantic interpretation of the slot in a linked data context. The URI may come from any namespace and may be shared between schemas.
comments: Assigning slot_uris can provide additional hooks for interoperation, indicating a common conceptual model

slots.name: multivalued
slots.description: true means that slot can have more than one value and should be represented using a list or collection structure.

slots.name: array
slots.description: coerces the value of the slot into an array and defines the dimensions of that array

slots.name: dimensions
slots.description: definitions of each axis in the array

slots.name: minimum_number_dimensions
slots.description: minimum number of dimensions in the array
comments: minimum_cardinality cannot be greater than maximum_cardinality

slots.name: maximum_number_dimensions
slots.description: maximum number of dimensions in the array, or False if explicitly no maximum. If this is unset, and an explicit list of dimensions are passed using dimensions, then this is interpreted as a closed list and the maximum_number_dimensions is the length of the dimensions list, unless this value is set to False
comments: maximum_number_dimensions cannot be less than minimum_number_dimensions

slots.name: exact_number_dimensions
slots.description: exact number of dimensions in the array
comments: if exact_number_dimensions is set, then minimum_number_dimensions and maximum_number_dimensions must be unset or have the same value

slots.name: inherited
slots.description: true means that the *value* of a slot is inherited by subclasses
comments: the slot is to be used for defining *metamodels* only
Inherited applies to slot values.  Parent *slots* are always inherited by subclasses

slots.name: readonly
slots.description: If present, slot is read only.  Text explains why
comments: the slot is to be used for defining *metamodels* only

slots.name: ifabsent
slots.description:
function that provides a default value for the slot.  Possible values for this slot are defined in linkml.utils.ifabsent_functions.default_library:
  * [Tt]rue -- boolean True
  * [Ff]alse -- boolean False
  * bnode -- blank node identifier
  * class_curie -- CURIE for the containing class
  * class_uri -- URI for the containing class
  * default_ns -- schema default namespace
  * default_range -- schema default range
  * int(value) -- integer value
  * slot_uri -- URI for the slot
  * slot_curie -- CURIE for the slot
  * string(value) -- string value

slots.name: implicit_prefix
slots.description: Causes the slot value to be interpreted as a uriorcurie after prefixing with this string

slots.name: value_specification_constant
slots.description: Grouping for metamodel slots that constrain the a slot value to equal a specified constant

slots.name: list_value_specification_constant
slots.description: Grouping for metamodel slots that constrain members of a multivalued slot value to equal a specified constant

slots.name: value_presence
slots.description: if true then a value must be present (for lists there must be at least one value). If false then a value must be absent (for lists, must be empty)
comments: if set to true this has the same effect as required=true. In contrast, required=false allows a value to be present

slots.name: equals_string
slots.description: the slot must have range string and the value of the slot must equal the specified value

slots.name: equals_number
slots.description: the slot must have range of a number and the value of the slot must equal the specified value

slots.name: equals_expression
slots.description: the value of the slot must equal the value of the evaluated expression
comments: for example, a 'length' slot may have an equals_expression with value '(end-start)+1'

slots.name: exact_cardinality
slots.description: the exact number of entries for a multivalued slot
comments: if exact_cardinality is set, then minimum_cardinalty and maximum_cardinality must be unset or have the same value

slots.name: minimum_cardinality
slots.description: the minimum number of entries for a multivalued slot
comments: minimum_cardinality cannot be greater than maximum_cardinality

slots.name: maximum_cardinality
slots.description: the maximum number of entries for a multivalued slot
comments: maximum_cardinality cannot be less than minimum_cardinality

slots.name: equals_string_in
slots.description: the slot must have range string and the value of the slot must equal one of the specified values

slots.name: equals_number_in
slots.description: the slot must have range number and the value of the slot must equal one of the specified values

slots.name: has_member
slots.description: the value of the slot is multivalued with at least one member satisfying the condition

slots.name: all_members
slots.description: the value of the slot is multivalued with all members satisfying the condition

slots.name: singular_name
slots.description: a name that is used in the singular form
comments: this may be used in some schema translations where use of a singular form is idiomatic, for example RDF

slots.name: required
slots.description: true means that the slot must be present in instances of the class definition

slots.name: recommended
slots.description: true means that the slot should be present in instances of the class definition, but this is not required
comments: This is to be used where not all data is expected to conform to having a required field
If a slot is recommended, and it is not populated, applications must not treat this as an error. Applications may use this to inform the user of missing data

slots.name: inapplicable
slots.description: true means that values for this slot must not be present
comments: By default all slots are applicable. The main use case for this slot is as an override in a subclass

slots.name: inlined
slots.description: True means that keyed or identified slot appears in an outer structure by value.  False means that only the key or identifier for the slot appears within the domain, referencing a structure that appears elsewhere.
comments: classes without keys or identifiers are necessarily inlined as lists
only applicable in tree-like serializations, e.g json, yaml

slots.name: inlined_as_list
slots.description: True means that an inlined slot is represented as a list of range instances.  False means that an inlined slot is represented as a dictionary, whose key is the slot key or identifier and whose value is the range instance.
comments:
The default loader will accept either list or dictionary form as input.  This parameter controls internal
representation and output.

A keyed or identified class with one additional slot can be input in a third form, a dictionary whose key
is the key or identifier and whose value is the one additional element.  This form is still stored according
to the inlined_as_list setting.

slots.name: inlined_as_simple_dict
slots.description: True means that an inlined slot is represented as a simple dict whose values are all atoms

slots.name: list_elements_ordered
slots.description: If True, then the order of elements of a multivalued slot is guaranteed to be preserved. If False, the order may still be preserved but this is not guaranteed
comments: should only be used with multivalued slots

slots.name: list_elements_unique
slots.description: If True, then there must be no duplicates in the elements of a multivalued slot
comments: should only be used with multivalued slots

slots.name: shared
slots.description: If True, then the relationship between the slot domain and range is many to one or many to many

slots.name: key
slots.description: True means that the key slot(s) uniquely identify the elements within a single container
comments: key is inherited
a given domain can have at most one key slot (restriction to be removed in the future)
identifiers and keys are mutually exclusive.  A given domain cannot have both
a key slot is automatically required.  Keys cannot be optional

slots.name: identifier
slots.description: True means that the key slot(s) uniquely identifies the elements. There can be at most one identifier or key per container
comments: identifier is inherited
a key slot is automatically required.  Identifiers cannot be optional
a given domain can have at most one identifier
identifiers and keys are mutually exclusive.  A given domain cannot have both

slots.name: designates_type
slots.description: True means that the key slot(s) is used to determine the instantiation (types) relation between objects and a ClassDefinition

slots.name: alias
slots.description: the name used for a slot in the context of its owning class.  If present, this is used instead of the actual slot name.
comments: an example of alias is used within this metamodel, slot_definitions is aliases as slots
not to be confused with aliases, which indicates a set of terms to be used for search purposes.

slots.name: owner
slots.description: the "owner" of the slot. It is the class if it appears in the slots list, otherwise the declaring slot
slots.deprecated: Will be replaced by domain_of and eventually removed
slots.readonly: filled in by loader -- either class domain or slot domain

slots.name: domain_of
slots.description: the class(es) that reference the slot in a "slots" or "slot_usage" context

slots.name: is_usage_slot
slots.description: True means that this slot was defined in a slot_usage situation

slots.name: usage_slot_name
slots.description: The name of the slot referenced in the slot_usage

slots.name: subproperty_of
slots.description: Ontology property which this slot is a subproperty of.  Note: setting this property on a slot does not guarantee an expansion of the ontological hierarchy into an enumerated list of possible values in every serialization of the model.

examples.description: this is the RO term for "in homology relationship with", and used as a value of subproperty of this means that any ontological child (related to RO:HOM0000001 via an is_a relationship), is a valid value for the slot that declares this with the subproperty_of tag.  This differs from the 'values_from' meta model component in that 'values_from' requires the id of a value set (said another way, if an entire ontology had a curie/identifier that was the identifier for the entire ontology, then that identifier would be used in 'values_from.')

slots.name: disjoint_with
slots.description: Two classes are disjoint if they have no instances in common, two slots are disjoint if they can never hold between the same two instances

slots.name: children_are_mutually_disjoint
slots.description: If true then all direct is_a children are mutually disjoint and share no instances in common

slots.name: relational_logical_characteristic
slots.description: An abstract grouping for metaslots that describe logical properties of a slot

slots.name: symmetric
slots.description: If s is symmetric, and i.s=v, then v.s=i

slots.name: asymmetric
slots.description: If s is antisymmetric, and i.s=v where i is different from v, v.s cannot have value i
comments: asymmetry is the combination of antisymmetry and irreflexivity

slots.name: reflexive
slots.description: If s is reflexive, then i.s=i for all instances i
comments: it is rare for a property to be reflexive, this characteristic is added for completeness, consider instead locally_reflexive

slots.name: irreflexive
slots.description: If s is irreflexive, then there exists no i such i.s=i

slots.name: locally_reflexive
slots.description: If s is locally_reflexive, then i.s=i for all instances i where s is a class slot for the type of i

slots.name: transitive
slots.description: If s is transitive, and i.s=z, and s.s=j, then i.s=j

slots.name: transitive_form_of
slots.description: If s transitive_form_of d, then (1) s holds whenever d holds (2) s is transitive (3) d holds whenever s holds and there are no intermediates, and s is not reflexive
comments: Example: ancestor_of is the transitive_form_of parent_of

slots.name: reflexive_transitive_form_of
slots.description: transitive_form_of including the reflexive case

slots.name: inverse
slots.description: indicates that any instance of d s r implies that there is also an instance of r s' d

slots.name: is_class_field
slots.description: indicates that for any instance, i, the domain of this slot will include an assertion of i s range

slots.name: role
slots.description: a textual descriptor that indicates the role played by the slot range
comments: the primary use case for this slot is to provide a textual descriptor of a generic slot name when used in the context of a more specific class

slots.name: minimum_value
slots.description: For ordinal ranges, the value must be equal to or higher than this
notes: Range to be refined to an "Ordinal" metaclass - see https://github.com/linkml/linkml/issues/1384#issuecomment-1892721142

slots.name: maximum_value
slots.description: For ordinal ranges, the value must be equal to or lower than this
notes: Range to be refined to an "Ordinal" metaclass - see https://github.com/linkml/linkml/issues/1384#issuecomment-1892721142

slots.name: interpolated
slots.description: if true then the pattern is first string interpolated

slots.name: partial_match
slots.description: if not true then the pattern must match the whole string, as if enclosed in ^...$

slots.name: pattern
slots.description: the string value of the slot must conform to this regular expression expressed in the string

slots.name: syntax
slots.description: the string value of the slot must conform to this regular expression expressed in the string. May be interpolated.

slots.name: structured_pattern
slots.description: the string value of the slot must conform to the regular expression in the pattern expression

slots.name: string_serialization
slots.description:
Used on a slot that stores the string serialization of the containing object. The syntax follows python formatted strings, with slot names enclosed in {}s. These are expanded using the values of those slots.
We call the slot with the serialization the s-slot, the slots used in the {}s are v-slots. If both s-slots and v-slots are populated on an object then the value of the s-slot should correspond to the expansion.
Implementations of frameworks may choose to use this property to either (a) PARSE: implement automated normalizations by parsing denormalized strings into complex objects (b) GENERARE: implement automated to_string labeling of complex objects
For example, a Measurement class may have 3 fields: unit, value, and string_value. The string_value slot may have a string_serialization of {value}{unit} such that if unit=cm and value=2, the value of string_value shouldd be 2cm

slots.name: typeof
slots.description: A parent type from which type properties are inherited
comments: the target type definition of the typeof slot is referred to as the "parent type"
the type definition containing the typeof slot is referred to as the "child type"
type definitions without a typeof slot are referred to as a "root type"

slots.name: base
slots.description: python base type in the LinkML runtime that implements this type definition
comments: every root type must have a base
the base is inherited by child types but may be overridden.  Base compatibility is not checked.

slots.name: type_uri
slots.description: The uri that defines the possible values for the type definition
comments: uri is typically drawn from the set of URI's defined in OWL (https://www.w3.org/TR/2012/REC-owl2-syntax-20121211/#Datatype_Maps)
every root type must have a type uri

slots.name: repr
slots.description: the name of the python object that implements this type definition

slots.name: alt_description_text
slots.description: text of an attributed description

slots.name: alt_description_source
slots.description: the source of an attributed description

slots.name: alt_descriptions
slots.description: A sourced alternative description for an element

slots.name: value
slots.description: example value

slots.name: value_description
slots.description: description of what the value is doing

slots.name: value_object
slots.description: direct object representation of the example

slots.name: examples
slots.description: example usages of an element

slots.name: prefix_prefix
slots.description: The prefix components of a prefix expansions. This is the part that appears before the colon in a CURIE.

slots.name: prefix_reference
slots.description: The namespace to which a prefix expands to.

slots.name: prefixes
slots.description: A collection of prefix expansions that specify how CURIEs can be expanded to URIs

slots.name: setting_key
slots.description: the variable name for a setting

slots.name: setting_value
slots.description: The value assigned for a setting

slots.name: settings
slots.description: A collection of global variable settings
comments: global variables are used in string interpolation in structured patterns

slots.name: local_name_source
slots.description: the ncname of the source of the name

slots.name: local_name_value
slots.description: a name assigned to an element in a given ontology

slots.name: slot_group
slots.description: allows for grouping of related slots into a grouping slot that serves the role of a group
comments: slot groups do not change the semantics of a model but are a useful way of visually grouping related slots

slots.name: is_grouping_slot
slots.description: true if this slot is a grouping slot

slots.name: followed_by
slots.description: in a sequential list, this indicates the next member

slots.name: reversed
slots.description: true if the slot is to be inversed

slots.name: traverse
slots.description: the slot to traverse

slots.name: path_rule
slots.description: a rule for inferring a slot assignment based on evaluating a path through a sequence of slot assignments

slots.name: represents_relationship
slots.description: true if this class represents a relationship rather than an entity
comments: in the context of Entity-Relationship (ER) modeling, this is used to state that a class models a relationship between entities, and should be drawn with a diamond
in the context of RDF, this should be used when instances of the class are `rdf:Statement`s
in the context of property graphs, this should be used when a class is used to represent an edge that connects nodes

slots.name: relational_role
slots.description: the role a slot on a relationship class plays, for example, the subject, object or predicate roles
comments: this should only be used on slots that are applicable to class that represent relationships
in the context of RDF, this should be used for slots that can be modeled using the RDF reification vocabulary
in the context of property graphs, this should be used on edge classes to indicate which slots represent the input and output nodes

slots.name: mappings
slots.description: A list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have comparable meaning. These may include terms that are precisely equivalent, broader or narrower in meaning, or otherwise semantically related but not equivalent from a strict ontological perspective.

slots.name: exact_mappings
slots.description: A list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have identical meaning.

slots.name: close_mappings
slots.description: A list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have close meaning.

slots.name: related_mappings
slots.description: A list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have related meaning.

slots.name: narrow_mappings
slots.description: A list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have narrower meaning.

slots.name: broad_mappings
slots.description: A list of terms from different schemas or terminology systems that have broader meaning.

slots.name: deprecated_element_has_exact_replacement
slots.description: When an element is deprecated, it can be automatically replaced by this uri or curie

slots.name: deprecated_element_has_possible_replacement
slots.description: When an element is deprecated, it can be potentially replaced by this uri or curie

slots.name: extensions
slots.description: a tag/text tuple attached to an arbitrary element

slots.name: extension_tag
slots.description: a tag associated with an extension

slots.name: extension_value
slots.description: the actual annotation

slots.name: annotations
slots.description: a collection of tag/text tuples with the semantics of OWL Annotation

slots.name: unit
slots.description: an encoding of a unit

slots.name: ucum_code
slots.description: associates a QUDT unit with its UCUM code (case-sensitive).

slots.name: derivation
slots.description: Expression for deriving this unit from other units

slots.name: has_quantity_kind
slots.description: Concept in a vocabulary or ontology that denotes the kind of quantity being measured, e.g. length
comments: Potential ontologies include but are not limited to PATO, NCIT, OBOE, qudt.quantityKind

slots.name: symbol
slots.description: name of the unit encoded as a symbol

slots.name: abbreviation
slots.description: An abbreviation for a unit is a short ASCII string that is used in place of the full name for the unit in  contexts where non-ASCII characters would be problematic, or where using the abbreviation will enhance  readability. When a power of a base unit needs to be expressed, such as squares this can be done using  abbreviations rather than symbols (source: qudt)

slots.name: descriptive_name
slots.description: the spelled out name of the unit, for example, meter

slots.name: schema_definition_name
slots.description: a unique name for the schema that is both human-readable and consists of only characters from the NCName set

slots.name: type_expression_any_of
slots.description: holds if at least one of the expressions hold

slots.name: type_expression_all_of
slots.description: holds if all of the expressions hold

slots.name: type_expression_exactly_one_of
slots.description: holds if only one of the expressions hold

slots.name: type_expression_none_of
slots.description: holds if none of the expressions hold

slots.name: type_definition_union_of
slots.description: indicates that the domain element consists exactly of the members of the element in the range.
notes: this only applies in the OWL generation

slots.name: structured_alias_categories
slots.description: The category or categories of an alias. This can be drawn from any relevant vocabulary
comments: if you wish to use uncontrolled terms or terms that lack identifiers then use the keywords element

slots.name: path_expression_followed_by
slots.description: in a sequential list, this indicates the next member

slots.name: path_expression_any_of
slots.description: holds if at least one of the expressions hold

slots.name: path_expression_exactly_one_of
slots.description: holds if only one of the expressions hold

slots.name: path_expression_none_of
slots.description: holds if none of the expressions hold

slots.name: path_expression_all_of
slots.description: holds if all of the expressions hold

slots.name: slot_expression_any_of
slots.description: holds if at least one of the expressions hold

slots.name: slot_expression_all_of
slots.description: holds if all of the expressions hold

slots.name: slot_expression_exactly_one_of
slots.description: holds if only one of the expressions hold

slots.name: slot_expression_none_of
slots.description: holds if none of the expressions hold

slots.name: slot_definition_is_a
slots.description: A primary parent slot from which inheritable metaslots are propagated

slots.name: slot_definition_mixins
slots.description: A collection of secondary parent mixin slots from which inheritable metaslots are propagated
comments: mixins act in the same way as parents (is_a). They allow a model to have a primary strict hierarchy, while keeping the benefits of multiple inheritance

slots.name: slot_definition_apply_to
slots.description: Used to extend class or slot definitions. For example, if we have a core schema where a gene has two slots for identifier and symbol, and we have a specialized schema for my_organism where we wish to add a slot systematic_name, we can avoid subclassing by defining a class gene_my_organism, adding the slot to this class, and then adding an apply_to pointing to the gene class. The new slot will be 'injected into' the gene class.

slots.name: slot_definition_disjoint_with
slots.description: Two classes are disjoint if they have no instances in common, two slots are disjoint if they can never hold between the same two instances

slots.name: slot_definition_union_of
slots.description: indicates that the domain element consists exactly of the members of the element in the range.
notes: this only applies in the OWL generation

slots.name: class_expression_any_of
slots.description: holds if at least one of the expressions hold

slots.name: class_expression_all_of
slots.description: holds if all of the expressions hold

slots.name: class_expression_exactly_one_of
slots.description: holds if only one of the expressions hold

slots.name: class_expression_none_of
slots.description: holds if none of the expressions hold

slots.name: class_definition_is_a
slots.description: A primary parent class from which inheritable metaslots are propagated

slots.name: class_definition_mixins
slots.description: A collection of secondary parent mixin classes from which inheritable metaslots are propagated
comments: mixins act in the same way as parents (is_a). They allow a model to have a primary strict hierarchy, while keeping the benefits of multiple inheritance

slots.name: class_definition_apply_to
slots.description: Used to extend class or slot definitions. For example, if we have a core schema where a gene has two slots for identifier and symbol, and we have a specialized schema for my_organism where we wish to add a slot systematic_name, we can avoid subclassing by defining a class gene_my_organism, adding the slot to this class, and then adding an apply_to pointing to the gene class. The new slot will be 'injected into' the gene class.

slots.name: class_definition_rules
slots.description: the collection of rules that apply to all members of this class

slots.name: class_definition_disjoint_with
slots.description: Two classes are disjoint if they have no instances in common, two slots are disjoint if they can never hold between the same two instances

slots.name: class_definition_union_of
slots.description: indicates that the domain element consists exactly of the members of the element in the range.
notes: this only applies in the OWL generation

slots.name: permissible_value_is_a
slots.description: A primary parent class or slot from which inheritable metaslots are propagated from. While multiple inheritance is not allowed, mixins can be provided effectively providing the same thing. The semantics are the same when translated to formalisms that allow MI (e.g. RDFS/OWL). When translating to a SI framework (e.g. java classes, python classes) then is a is used. When translating a framework without polymorphism (e.g. json-schema, solr document schema) then is a and mixins are recursively unfolded

slots.name: permissible_value_mixins
slots.description: A collection of secondary parent classes or slots from which inheritable metaslots are propagated from.
comments: mixins act in the same way as parents (is_a). They allow a model to have a primary strict hierarchy, while keeping the benefits of multiple inheritance

slots.name: UnitOfMeasure_exact_mappings
slots.description: Used to link a unit to equivalent concepts in ontologies such as UO, SNOMED, OEM, OBOE, NCIT
comments: Do not use this to encode mappings to systems for which a dedicated field exists

classes.name: CommonMetadata
classes.description: Generic metadata shared across definitions

classes.name: Element
classes.description: A named element in the model

classes.name: SchemaDefinition
classes.description: A collection of definitions that make up a schema or a data model.

classes.name: TypeExpression
classes.description: An abstract class grouping named types and anonymous type expressions

classes.name: AnonymousTypeExpression
classes.description: A type expression that is not a top-level named type definition. Used for nesting.

classes.name: TypeDefinition
classes.description: an element that whose instances are atomic scalar values that can be mapped to primitive types

classes.name: SubsetDefinition
classes.description: an element that can be used to group other metamodel elements

classes.name: Definition
classes.description: abstract base class for core metaclasses

classes.name: EnumExpression
classes.description: An expression that constrains the range of a slot

classes.name: AnonymousEnumExpression
classes.description: An enum_expression that is not named

classes.name: EnumDefinition
classes.description: an element whose instances must be drawn from a specified set of permissible values

classes.name: MatchQuery
classes.description: A query that is used on an enum expression to dynamically obtain a set of permissivle values via a query that  matches on properties of the external concepts.

classes.name: ReachabilityQuery
classes.description: A query that is used on an enum expression to dynamically obtain a set of permissible values via walking from a  set of source nodes to a set of descendants or ancestors over a set of relationship types.

classes.name: StructuredAlias
classes.description: object that contains meta data about a synonym or alias including where it came from (source) and its scope (narrow, broad, etc.)

classes.name: Expression
classes.description: general mixin for any class that can represent some form of expression

classes.name: AnonymousExpression
classes.description: An abstract parent class for any nested expression
comments: anonymous expressions are useful for when it is necessary to build a complex expression without introducing a named element for each sub-expression

classes.name: PathExpression
classes.description: An expression that describes an abstract path from an object to another through a sequence of slot lookups

classes.name: SlotExpression
classes.description: an expression that constrains the range of values a slot can take

classes.name: SlotDefinition
classes.description: an element that describes how instances are related to other instances

classes.name: ClassExpression
classes.description: A boolean expression that can be used to dynamically determine membership of a class

classes.name: ClassDefinition
classes.description: an element whose instances are complex objects that may have slot-value assignments

classes.name: ClassLevelRule
classes.description: A rule that is applied to classes

classes.name: ClassRule
classes.description: A rule that applies to instances of a class

classes.name: ArrayExpression
classes.description: defines the dimensions of an array

classes.name: DimensionExpression
classes.description: defines one of the dimensions of an array

classes.name: PatternExpression
classes.description: a regular expression pattern used to evaluate conformance of a string

classes.name: ImportExpression
classes.description: an expression describing an import

classes.name: Setting
classes.description: assignment of a key to a value

classes.name: Prefix
classes.description: prefix URI tuple

classes.name: LocalName
classes.description: an attributed label

classes.name: Example
classes.description: usage example and description

classes.name: AltDescription
classes.description: an attributed description

classes.name: PermissibleValue
classes.description: a permissible value, accompanied by intended text and an optional mapping to a concept URI

classes.name: UniqueKey
classes.description: a collection of slots whose values uniquely identify an instance of a class

classes.name: Extension
classes.description: a tag/value pair used to add non-model information to an entry

classes.name: Extensible
classes.description: mixin for classes that support extension

classes.name: Annotatable
classes.description: mixin for classes that support annotations

classes.name: Annotation
classes.description: a tag/value pair with the semantics of OWL Annotation

classes.name: UnitOfMeasure
classes.description: A unit of measure, or unit, is a particular quantity value that has been chosen as a scale for  measuring other quantities the same kind (more generally of equivalent dimension).
